metadata.case_name: Appellant No. 1 & Appellant No. 2 v. Respondent No. 1 & Respondent No. 2

facts.text: Notification fixing time-schedule for elections issued on 13th January 1967: last date for filing nominations 20th January 1967, scrutiny 21st January 1967, last date for withdrawal 23rd January 1967.
Only eight candidates filed nominations within time up to 20th January 1967, including Appellant No. 1; Respondent No. 1 not included among them initially.
Appellant No. 1's nomination sponsored by many people; Appellant No. 2 a voter in Shiggaon Constituency.
Respondent No. 1 not a voter in Shiggaon Constituency but in different constituency; alleged no relevant electoral roll portion attached to nomination.
No deposit under s. 34 of RP Act made in time by Respondent No. 1.
Respondent No. 1 allegedly failed to make oath/affirmation under Art. 173(a) before authorized person.
All other candidates except Appellant No. 1 withdrew validly; Respondent No. 1 declared elected unopposed on scrutiny date.

Appellants allege corrupt practices by Patil Puttappa (MP, supporter of Resp No. 1) and Mahalinga Shetty (son-in-law of Resp No. 1) using PW3 (Hotti Peerasabnavar Chamensab Ghudusab) and PW4 (Nadaf Mohamad Jafar Saheb) to induce Appellant No. 1 to withdraw by promises of huller licence, paper agency, business aid.
On 20th January 1967 at 8.30 p.m., PW4 took Appellant No. 1 to car with Patil Puttappa who persuaded withdrawal promising aid; Appellant No. 1 refused initially.
Patil Puttappa revealed desire for uncontested return of Resp No. 1; assured arrangements for nomination.

Appellant No. 1 and No. 2 taken to house of RW3 (Hanumanthagouda Ayyangouda Patil); further persuasion, then threats by Patil Puttappa as MP who could 'do anything'; forced signatures on blank withdrawal form and papers.
Appellants allegedly confined in RW3's house from night 20th Jan to 4.30 a.m. 22nd Jan 1967.
Withdrawal form of Appellant No. 1 filed by someone other than him or agent, with aid of Returning Officer (Resp No. 2).
Post-release, Appellants went to Hubli, saw newspaper on 22nd Jan about Resp No. 1 elected unopposed; consulted PW2 (lawyer) at 3 p.m., sent telegram at 4.35 p.m. to RO denying withdrawal.
RO received telegram 22nd Jan evening but ignored as telegram.
Appellant No. 1 addressed meeting in Hubli late 22nd Jan; returned Shiggaon 25th Jan.
Resp No. 1 affirmed before RO Shiggaon just before scrutiny 21st Jan 1967; earlier affirmation rejected for Kundagol.
Resp No. 1 filed nomination Bagalkot 19th Jan afternoon with affirmation same day; Hospet (Hoovinahadagali) affirmation night 20th Jan.
Nomination paper of Resp No. 1 presented by RW3 (proposer) with electoral roll copy and deposit receipt.
Withdrawal of Appellant No. 1 presented by him personally.
PW3 stated met Resp No. 1 21st Jan, then informed Appellant No. 1 at his house (contradicts confinement).
PW1 (photographer) took photos 21st Jan 5 p.m. RO office; Appellant No. 1 took copies same day.
Vishal Karnataka morning 22nd Jan news: one candidate forced to withdraw by threat; supports pro-Appellant No. 1.
No police complaint by Appellants re confinement.
Election petition filed; dismissed by Mysore HC 4,7,8 Aug 1967.

legal_issues.text: Whether Respondent No. 1 disqualified under Article 173(a) for failure to timely make/subscribe oath/affirmation before Returning Officer of Shiggaon Constituency.
Whether corrupt practices (bribery, undue influence, obtaining assistance from Returning Officer) committed with consent of Respondent No. 1 to procure withdrawal of Appellant No. 1.
Whether nomination paper of Respondent No. 1 validly filed on 20th Jan with required documents and deposit.

petitioner_arguments.text: Oath/affirmation must precede filing of nomination or at latest before date of scrutiny (by midnight 20/21 Jan); affirmation on 21st Jan before scrutiny invalid per s.36(2)(a) RP Act and Pashupati Nath Singh case.
petitioner_arguments.legal_basis: Article 173(a) Constitution; s.36(2)(a) RP Act 1951; Pashupati Nath Singh v. Harihar Prasad Singh

petitioner_arguments.text: No nomination filed by Resp No. 1 by 20th Jan; if filed, lacked electoral roll copy (not Shiggaon voter), deposit receipt; RO aided corruptly.

Corrupt practices: bribery (promises of licence/agency), undue influence/threats by Patil Puttappa et al leading to forced signatures and confinement; withdrawal faked with RO aid; consent of Resp No. 1.
Adverse inference against Resp No. 1 for not examining Patil Puttappa.
petitioner_arguments.legal_basis: Dr. M. Chenna Reddy v. V. Ramachandra Rao; R.M. Seshadri v. G. Vasantha Pai

respondent_arguments.text: Affirmation made before RO Shiggaon before scrutiny on 21st Jan valid; alternatively, affirmations at Bagalkot (19th Jan) and Hospet (20th Jan) suffice as one oath qualifies for any constituency.
respondent_arguments.legal_basis: Article 173(a) Constitution; Election Commission notification dated 2nd Jan 1965

respondent_arguments.text: Nomination filed 20th Jan with all requirements by proposer RW3; deposit made.

No corrupt practices; Appellants' version false - voluntary withdrawal by Appellant No. 1 personally; evidence unreliable, contradicted by circumstances (PW3/PW1 statements, newspaper 22nd Jan morning).
No need to examine Patil Puttappa as Appellants' evidence disproved.
respondent_arguments.legal_basis: R.M. Seshadri v. G. Vasantha Pai

court_reasoning.text: Oath must be before date of scrutiny per s.36(2)(a); 21st Jan affirmation before scrutiny invalid as not by midnight 20/21; but earlier affirmations at Bagalkot/Hospet before respective ROs qualify under Art.173(a) as one oath removes disqualification for state legislature candidature from any constituency.
court_reasoning.key_observation: Purpose of Art.173(a) is single oath/affirmation of allegiance; Election Commission notification requires before RO of 'that constituency' but prior valid oath suffices.

court_reasoning.text: All witnesses interested; Appellants' confinement/bribery story improbable, disproved by PW3 (saw Appellant No.1 home 21st evening), PW1 (photos collected 21st), Vishal Karnataka news 22nd morning (pre-release), no police complaint, post-release conduct.
court_reasoning.key_observation: Circumstantial evidence falsifies version; no proof of corrupt practices.

court_reasoning.text: RO evidence on nomination/withdrawal credible, supported by documents; no direct evidence contra.
No adverse inference re Patil Puttappa as Appellants' case disproved; no need for court witness.
court_reasoning.key_observation: Evidence already sufficient to reject charges.

holdings.text: Affirmation made prior in other constituencies before their ROs satisfies Art.173(a); no disqualification.
No corrupt practices proved; evidence unreliable and disproved.
Nomination and election of Resp No. 1 valid.

precedents_cited.case_name: Pashupati Nath Singh v. Harihar Prasad Singh
precedents_cited.relevance: Oath/affirmation must be before date fixed for scrutiny under s.36(2)(a) RP Act.

precedents_cited.case_name: Dr. M. Chenna Reddy v. V. Ramachandra Rao
precedents_cited.relevance: Non-examination of key witness as circumstance after petitioner's evidence accepted.

precedents_cited.case_name: R. M. Seshadri v. G. Vasantha Pai
precedents_cited.relevance: Court power to summon court witnesses for corrupt practices; no need if evidence disproved.

precedents_cited.case_name: Nani Gopal Swami v. Abdul Hamid Choudhury
precedents_cited.relevance: Respondent not absolved from producing best evidence.

statutes_cited.name: Representation of the People Act, 1951
statutes_cited.relevance: Appeal provision; deposit; scrutiny date for qualifications; corrupt practices of bribery, undue influence, official duty assistance.

statutes_cited.name: Constitution of India
statutes_cited.relevance: Qualification requiring oath/affirmation before authorized person for state legislature candidature.

outcome.summary: Appeal against dismissal of election petition challenging unopposed election of Respondent No. 1 from Shiggaon Constituency dismissed; held no disqualification under Art.173(a), no corrupt practices proved, nomination valid.
outcome.costs: Dismissed with costs; one set of costs for hearing.

key_quotes.text: "Once such an oath or affirmation is made before a competent authority in respect of one constituency, he becomes bound by that oath or affirmation even if he gets elected to the Legislature from a different constituency."
key_quotes.speaker: court
key_quotes.significance: Core holding on sufficiency of single prior oath under Art.173(a).

key_quotes.text: "The story that has been put forward on behalf of the appellants has already been described by us in detail when giving the facts of the case... there was plenty of circumstantial evidence indicating that the version put forward on behalf of the appellants could not be true."
key_quotes.speaker: court
key_quotes.significance: Rejection of corrupt practices based on evidence assessment.

key_quotes.text: "The appellants alleged that they were taken to the house of R.W. 3 in the early hours of the night of 20th January, 1967 and were kept in confinement till the morning of 22nd January, 1967."
key_quotes.speaker: court
